group_1.textRight: Um... I just overheard that the cafe is@closing down...
Our teacher was in the back room...
She was talking to the cafe owner about@not being able to keep running it.

group_1.textLeft: B-but that's...so sudden... Let's try to stay@calm, okay?
(Is she teasing me? She likes to do that...)

group_1.textRight: What am I going to do? I was finally@feeling closer to achieving my dream...

group_1.narration: Like me, many of the girls@who worked at this maid cafe@hadn't found their spotlight yet...
So, even though it was a small stage,@it was a place where we could perform@for an audience, to make them happy.@It was a special place for all of us.

group_1.textRight: I didn't know you were here.

group_1.textLeft: The maid cafe isn't closing, is it? Please@tell me it's not...
We can't keep it a secret forever...

group_1.textRight: That's true... Wait here, I'll make some tea.

group_1.narration: I remember how cold my@fingertips felt at that moment.
I remember that the tea the owner@had made felt terribly hot, too.

group_1.textLeft: Let me be perfectly clear... This is not your@fault, girls.

group_1.textRight: Yes, it's a rather complicated management@issue.

group_1.narration: The owner and our teacher told us that@the cafe was getting evicted because@the building was old and had to be demolished.
They were looking for a new location,@but hadn't found anything yet.
They were also considering shutting@down the maid cafe business if@they couldn't find a new spot.

group_1.textRight: We're still asking around, hoping to find a@solution...
But be prepared, just in case.

group_1.narration: Then...@After I calmed the other girl@down and walked her safely home...

group_1.textRight: Hey, it's been a while, Ikumi.

group_1.textLeft: I told you before, I don't plan on becoming@an idol by making a wish. Remember?
I'm busy right now. Please leave.

group_1.textRight: I sure would like it if you'd remember what@I said before.

group_1.narration: At the time, all I could think about@was keeping the maid cafe going.
I didn't want to lose that place no matter@what. For the younger students with the @same dream as me, my predecessor who@trusted me, and of course for myself.
I went home and did some legal research...

group_1.textLeft: I'm really happy you cared enough to look @into landlord tenant law.
But we already talked to our lawyers about@that.
They said we can't fight the eviction.

group_1.narration: Obviously, the teachers already thought@of any solution that I could come up with...@So there wasn't anything I could do.
There wasn't anything our teacher@or the owner could do either...
There was no way an ordinary student@like me could solve anything...
